Blade of Baz is the first book from Project Bookworm.
This token gives you a preview of the story.
Mint the full token with audiobook for the rest of the section.
Project Bookworm is releasing one section per epoch from
Blade of Baz, by Jillian Plomin.
Collect the whole book to receive a signed special
edition hard copy when the book is printed, and admission
to our special event at cNFTcon in Las Vegas October 7-9
and Rare Bloom in Denver October 14-15.
Token 18 Preview:
The water beneath Erica shifted. The waves that had been
gently lapping away from the sandy shore and back suddenly
changed direction. Water rose up before her. All at once,
crashing waves rushed together from her left and her right
to form a dual tidal wave that rose several feet into the
air and knocked Erica onto her back. She scrambled to her
feet gasping for breath and drenched from head to toe. When
she looked out toward Fair Plains again, the sun’s reflection
was no longer there. Instead, the sea steadily receded to
reveal a sandy white land bridge, and an ear-splitting cheer
rose up from the throngs on the other side. Lidian and Tom
broke through the front lines and marched excitedly toward
her as Adelinde, Owen, and Rasul appeared at her sides.
"Are you all right?" Owen asked, steadying her by
the elbow. Erica nodded, and spit out more salty seawater.
"What was that?" Erica coughed the last few drops of water
out of her throat and watched Tom approaching with
a wide grin.
"That was the first bit of magic Orla had ever done
as a defense against her brother. No son of Baz has ever
been able to unveil the bridge to the Castle in the Sea."
Erica scowled and refolded her arms.
"Couldn’t they just take a boat like we did?"
"Well, yes," Owen stuttered, "But that wasn’t the point.
It was a symbolic division, marking her breaking free
of the bond to her brother."
Erica shook her head and sighed. "Pointless magic."

Blade of Baz Preview 18.name: Blade of Baz
Blade of Baz Preview 18.author: Jillian Plomin
Story overview: Ryan and Erica are typical high school students—or so they
think. They have hobbies and homework and friends, and are
generally normal siblings. But one October evening, they
find a curious object that rips them from their cozy suburban
home into a world of rebels, royals, legends, and swords. The
pair now have to find their way back from the strange land of
Aulmagne, but in doing so they ignite chaos and rebellion in
the Aulmagnian people, upsetting the tyrannical rule of
Chancellor Ulrich. Will Ryan and Erica ever make it home,
or are they trapped in this world forever?
